revised_title: Vitamin A and B12: Biochemistry, Nutrition, and Unusual Isomers
tldr: This article discusses the biochemistry and nutrition of vitamins A and B12, focusing on the unique isomers found in marine organisms. It explores the conversion of carotene into vitamin A, the role of 11-cis vitamin A in crustacean eyes, and the presence of vitamin A aldehyde in eggs. The article also touches upon the effects of vitamin A on tissue culture and its potential influence on sulphate metabolism.
